  • Type Parameters:
    ADAPTER - is the generic type of AbstractUiWidgetNative.getWidgetAdapter().
    VALUE - is the generic type of the value.
    ADAPTER_VALUE - is the generic type of the adapter value.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadTrimValue, AttributeReadValidationFailure, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeReadValueAsString, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteAriaRole, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteLabel, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteTrimValue, AttributeWriteValidationFailure, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeWriteValueAsString, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureFocus, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureValidation<VALUE>, UiFeatureValue<VALUE>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>, UiWidgetField<VALUE>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<VALUE>, UiWidgetActive, UiWidgetComposite<UiWidget>, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetRegularComposite<UiWidget>, UiWidgetWithValue<VALUE>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadValue<VALUE>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteValue<VALUE>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<VALUE>, ValidatableObject<VALUE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractUiWidgetCheckboxField, AbstractUiWidgetColorField, AbstractUiWidgetFileField, AbstractUiWidgetOptionsField, AbstractUiWidgetRangeField, AbstractUiWidgetTextualInputField

    public abstract class AbstractUiWidgetField<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterField<VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>,VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>
extends AbstractUiWidgetActive<ADAPTER,VALUE>
implements UiWidgetField<VALUE>
    This is the abstract base implementation of UiWidgetField.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • doGetValue

        protected VALUE doGetValue(VALUE template,
                           ValidationState state)
                    throws RuntimeException
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.getValue(). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. The following cases have to be distinguished:
        • For native fields this method has to get the actual value from the underlying native widget (text-box, password-field, etc.).
        • For custom fields this method will be responsible to convert from the delegates value (see UiWidgetCustom.getDelegate()) to the proper value type. E.g. if you want to create a custom widget to edit your own datatype such as CustomerNumber based on a UiWidgetTextField you need to convert from String to CustomerNumber.
        • For custom composite widgets you should use AbstractUiWidget.getDataBinding(). UiDataBinding.createAndBind(net.sf.mmm.util.pojo.path.api.TypedProperty) that gives you high-level support and makes your live easy. Then there is no need to override this method.
        • For other cases, especially if <VALUE> is Void, there is nothing to do here.
        The implementation of this method has to correspond with the implementation of AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean) .
        Overrides:
        doGetValue in class AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterField<VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>,VALUE>
        Parameters:
        template - is the object where the data is filled in. May only be null if according to data-binding (e.g. if <VALUE> is an (immutable) Datatype).
        state - is the ValidationState. May be null (if the validation is omitted). Should only be used to propagate to AbstractUiWidget.getValueDirect(Object, ValidationState) of children.
        Returns:
        the current value of this widget. May be null if empty. If <VALUE> is String the empty String has to be returned if no value has been entered. In case <VALUE> is a mutable object (java bean) the template is NOT null and is to be returned by this method after the value(s) of this widget have been assigned. For immutable datatypes template will be null and this method has to create a new instance of <VALUE> based on the end-users input in the widget.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean)

      • isTrimValue

        public final boolean isTrimValue()
        This method determines if the value of this object should be automatically trimmed. The default value is true. E.g. if a text field widget supports this property and it is true the value entered by the end-user will automatically be trimmed. If you want prevent this (e.g. if the end-user shall provide a separator, indentation, substitution variable, or the like) you need to set it to false.
        Specified by:
        isTrimValue in interface AttributeReadTrimValue
        Returns:
        true if the value of this object should be automatically trimmed.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • doSetValue

        protected void doSetValue(VALUE newValue,
                          boolean forUser)
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiWidget.setValue(Object, boolean). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. For details see AbstractUiWidget.doGetValue(Object, ValidationState).
        Overrides:
        doSetValue in class AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterField<VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>,VALUE>
        Parameters:
        newValue - is the value to set. Typically a composite object (e.g. java bean) so its attributes are set to fields (see UiWidgetField).
        forUser - true if called from AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.setValueForUser(Object), false if set from AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.setValue(Object).
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doGetValue(Object, ValidationState)

      • convertToValue

        protected VALUE convertToValue(ADAPTER_VALUE adapterValue,
                               ValidationState state)
        This method converts the given adapterValue from the widget adapter to the type of this value. The default implementation simply performs a cast. You have to override this method if <VALUE> and <WIDGET_VALUE> differ.
        Parameters:
        adapterValue - is the value to convert. Will NOT be null.
        state - is the ValidationState or null if not called without validation.
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • getNullValue

        protected ADAPTER_VALUE getNullValue()
        This method gets the result of convertFromValue(Object) for the value null. It is called for null values instead of convertFromValue(Object) to prevent NullPointerExceptions. The default is null - override to change.
        Returns:
        the value representation of null for the widget adapter.

      • convertFromValue

        protected ADAPTER_VALUE convertFromValue(VALUE widgetValue)
        This method converts the given widgetValue to the type used by the widget adapter. The default implementation simply performs a cast. You have to override this method if <VALUE> and <WIDGET_VALUE> differ.
        Parameters:
        widgetValue - is the value to convert. Will NOT be null (See getNullValue()).
        Returns:
        the converted value.

        public String getValidationFailure()

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the validation error text or null for no error.

      • setValidationFailure

        public void setValidationFailure(String validationFailure)
        This method sets the validation failure.
        ATTENTION:
        For regular usage you should use UiFeatureValidation. This method is only intended as back-door for very special cases (e.g. you have to use your own validator infrastructure and perform validation outside this framework). It is not recommended to use this method as an API user.
        Specified by:
        setValidationFailure in interface AttributeWriteValidationFailure
        Parameters:
        validationFailure - is the validation failure text. The empty string or null will clear the error and mark the field as valid. Otherwise the field will be invalid.

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel()
        This method gets the label of this object. A label is some text that is permanently shown to the user in the UI in order to describe the meaning of the object and in particular its value. For elements that allow to display or edit a value the label is typically shown beside the edit/display widget. For action elements such as buttons or links the label is the actual text (lettering).

        NOTE:
        Every field widget (UiWidgetField) has an associated label widget. This method gets its label text. Please note that the label widget is not contained in this field widget itself, so if you regularly add this field widget to some other widget you will not see the label. However, UiWidgetGridPanel also automatically adds the label widget. The recommended use-case is to create a form to view and edit your business object extending UiWidgetCustomGridPanel and use UiDataBinding.
        Unlike UiWidgetField.getLabelWidget().getLabel() this method prevents actually creating the label widget if it does NOT yet exist. Further it will only return what has been set via UiWidgetField.setLabel(String) and NOT what has potentially been set via UiWidgetField.getLabelWidget() . setLabel (what should be avoided).
        Specified by:
        getLabel in interface AttributeReadLabel
        Specified by:
        getLabel in interface UiWidgetField<VALUE>
        Returns:
        the label text. Will be the empty string if no label has been set.

      • setLabel

      • getLabelWidget

        public final UiWidgetLabel getLabelWidget()
        This method gets the label widget associated with this field.
        ATTENTION:
        Depending on the underlying toolkit the label widget is lazily created on the first call of this method. Additionally users of this API (unlike implementors of the API) may only use this for very specific cases (e.g. setting the style of the label). Therefore you should avoid calling this method unless you are aware of what you are doing. To access the label-text simply use UiWidgetField.getLabel() and UiWidgetField.setLabel(String). Be aware that some native toolkits (e.g. SmartGWT) already implement field widgets including the label. In this case this method will return a different view on the same native widget.
        Specified by:
        getLabelWidget in interface UiWidgetField<VALUE>
        Returns:
        the associated label widget.

      • getValueDirect

        public VALUE getValueDirect(VALUE template,
                            ValidationState state)
                     throws RuntimeException
        This method is a combination of AttributeReadValueAdvanced.getValueOrException(Object) and AbstractValidatableObject.validate(ValidationState). It allows more efficient implementations as determining and creating the value can be expensive. Saving changes requires validation AND on success getting the value, while already validation requires getting the value. For composite UI objects this effect would reinforce to multiply the number of calls to AttributeReadValueAdvanced.getValueOrException(Object).
        NOTE:
        This method is designed for implementors of composite UI objects. API users should only use UiFeatureValueAndValidation.getValueAndValidate(ValidationState).
        Specified by:
        getValueDirect in interface UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
        Overrides:
        getValueDirect in class AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        Parameters:
        template - is the object where the data is filled in. May also be null - then this method will create a new instance.
        state - is the ValidationState. If null the validation will be omitted, otherwise an implicit validation is performed.
        Returns:
        the current value. May be null (esp. if invalid).
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if state is null no validation is performed and input errors are directly thrown causing a fast fail. Otherwise if validation is performed all RuntimeException are catched and according validation failures are collected and visualized by the UI.

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible,
                       boolean programmatic)
        This method shows or hides this object.
        Specified by:
        setVisible in interface AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced
        Overrides:
        setVisible in class AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterField<VALUE,ADAPTER_VALUE>,VALUE>
        Parameters:
        visible - - see AbstractUiWidgetNative.setVisible(boolean).
        programmatic - - see UiEvent.isProgrammatic().
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidgetNative.setVisible(boolean)

      • getSource

        public String getSource()
        Overrides:
        getSource in class AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        Returns:
        a String representation of this object that qualifies as source description that might be displayed to end-users (unlike AbstractUiWidget.toString() what is for debugging only).
